TIKA-123: Structured MS Office parsing     - Changed OfficeParser to allow structured parsing in subclasses     - ExcelParser now outputs XHTML tables with nice tabs and line breaks     - Dropped unused formatting code from ExcelParser (TODO fix that)     - Streamlined PowerPointParser and started using Java 5 features     - No functional changes (yet) in PowerPointParser     - No functional changes (yet) in WordParser git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/tika/trunk@628475 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68
TIKA-123: Structured MS Office parsing     - New utility methods in XHTMLContentHandler git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/tika/trunk@628478 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

TIKA-199: Improved audio detection and parsing Streamlined the audio and midi parsers. Made sure that both use a BufferedInputStream wrapper as the native javax.sound parsers expect the given input stream to support the mark feature.git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/lucene/tika/trunk@741674 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

TIKA-702: Cannot compile Tika with Java 7 (ImageMetadataExtractor.java) Avoid using the troublesome JpegMetadataReader class from metadata-extractor.Normalize extracted metadata values to prevent different results being returned when running on Java 7.git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tika/trunk@1164617 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68
